descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Photojournalism is a visual reporting class that teaches students to make compelling images that convey multiple levels of information. Students will study past and current photojournalists and their contributions to journalism, as well as ethics while shooting and in the use of Photoshop. A foundation of camera knowledge and storytelling techniques will be enhanced with weekly critiques and discussions. Examining how photo editing impacts the presentation and perception of images is a key part of the course. Using provided equipment, students will complete the course with a portfolio of single images and in-depth photo stories.

Examples: * http://picturestory.knightlab.com/stories/lashonda.html * http://picturestory.knightlab.com/stories/jackie.html * http://picturestory.knightlab.com/stories/farm.html * http://picturestory.knightlab.com/stories/cattleranchers.html
